Only three tests. 2 extra credit options worth up to 10 points each. Easy A if you show up and take notes in class. Lecutres also on D2l
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Only grades are 3 test plus a lot of extra credit. However the test are extremely easy, I filled out the study guide and read it over once the night before and never got less than an 86. She is pretty easy going, boring lectures, but I only went to one class a week and had others sign me in. Don't buy the book, easy A.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: You have to study for this class. She doesn't really like the book so powerpoints are the way to study, as well as the online practice questions on D2L. It can be a lot of material to cover. She does however offer extra credit so be sure to do all of it. She tends to over complicate her explanations so don't hesitate to ask questions, super sassy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She's nice! I tend to skip class even though its mandatory. A simple teacher, she offers lots of extra credit. You only have 3 main grades and it's her 3 tests. She isn't a bad teacher at all, and she tries to make the class interesting.

She is very quiet. Lectures boring. Don't get the book, posts everything online. Class is mandatory. No homework. You are given practice tests and quizzes. She has extra credit. Only graded on tests. Avoid using group me. She wants students to use the discussion forum to communicate so she be in on the action.

Easy A. I did not go to class for more than half of the semester because lectures were extremely boring but you are only graded on 3 tests. She does not count attendance and she puts everything on D2l (including practice tests that are extremely similar to the real thing!).
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof Kirby was by far the WORST professor I have ever had. She changes things up day after day and believes every student is going to cheat on tests so she punishes everyone for it. She said that our 3rd test was ONLY CHAPTER 10, but there was a lot more than that chapter.I knew chapter 10 perfectly and still made a 58. I'll be lucky if I make a C
You have the opportunity for extra credit. Attendance, not mandatory. She posts most of the lecture information on D2L. Only 3 "Quizzes" and nothing else graded. Some quizzes may be online.

Prof. Kirby treated us like we were kids. She was easily the most boring lecturer I have ever had. She started as soon as she was able and monotonously talked for the entire duration. When students quit showing up, she quit posting material online and sent emails saying she was only putting material that she talked about in class on the tests. Bad.

Such a sweet lady!! I don't understand all of the negative posts, she is a great professor. She gives out so much bonus work that it's really easy to make a good grade. She doesn't have an attendance policy, and posts all the material online so you don't have to actually buy the book.

The professor is good at explaining basic econ, but I had taken a harder course in highschool and basically tuned out every class because it was so simple. Attendance isn't necessary and the online tests are super easy. Just know your econ and you'll be okay.
Three out of four tests are online. They are fairly easy. She does not explain anything at all. Don't even bother going to class. She was pretty easy, but I do not feel prepared at all.

I was one of the few people who actually attended every single class. I regret it. Her lectures rambled, she would reteach lessons, and she has an obsession with Venezuela. Changed test dates around because she couldn't finish lectures but eventually made all 3 online. I learned a bit from the book. She looks like Edna Mode from The Incredibles.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Kirby was alright. Her lectures were awful and she basically spent the semester talking about Venezuela and that's it. Attendance isn't mandatory; "it's for her own edification". Don't buy the book!!! She gives extra credit but it's not worth it. Grade is determined by 3 test grades & any bonus points divided by 3. Really easy class overall.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She pretty much has her lectures memorized so if youre confused, dont bother asking questions because she will just repeat word for word what she just said. Impossible to pay attention and even harder to learn. Attendance is "extra credit" but really doesnt count for much
She's very repetitive and doesn't explain things very well. When i asked a question for clarification she just made up an answer and when i tried to rebuttal she shut me down and changed the subject.
Took in summer session. Easy class. Two online tests and two in class. Extra credit for going to class and just trying to do it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Rambles, too monotone, not interesting. Class was decided on 4 tests, no quizzes or extra assignments. Not very inspirational. Would recommend possibly taking her during Fall or Spring- could not handle a 2hr 45min class during the summer. Too easy to get distracted in class with all of the rambling she does.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She literally speaks like a word-count essay.  Sometimes she would get to the end of her sentence,  and I would have forgotten what she was talking about.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She was okay. Didn't not explain a lot. Never got out early and often taught 5 minutes over. Would not take her again unless I had too.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you missed one of the three online test she averaged the other two to make the 3rd test grade. In my case, I would have made a higher grade in the class if I refrained from taking a test. I finished the class with an 89.39 and she wouldn't even reply to my emails. STAY AWAY if you want a professor that will actually help you.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very sassy professor if you answer a question wrong. First test is in class, next two are online, and the final is in class. The in class tests are hard, but the online tests are easy. Class is repetitive and I rarely went, but she does know what she's talking about. Wouldn't suggest as top pick professor.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Four tests, the first three are all online. Coming to class is basically pointless, you don't learn much, she's also very boring and annoying to listen to. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK

Going to this class will be a waste of you time which I figured after the first month. Her class became optional. Her lectures are repetitive and boring. At the beginning she says attendance is mandatory and electronics will be collected, but that was a joke.  Three of the tests were at home and the final is in class. Easy A.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I made an A in the class however I didn't think she was a very good teacher. I never learned anything from her. She gave lectures that were dull and boring. After the lecture, a couple of times she realized that she taught us something wrong. I feel bad giving this review, but I would rather have a teacher that I could learn something from.
Ms Kirby teaches at a very basic level, which i needed. You can not only get an easy A, you will actually walk away understanding basic ECON

Boring and very rude professor, but class is optional and not even necessary. I went to class 2/3 times a week and always sat on my phone the whole time but made a solid A. You can cheat on the tests if you want. If you have morals, just read the book and free A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Easy A. Professor Kirby is a good lecturer, but I barely went to class and still made an A. Just know what's expected of you. 2 online tests, 1 in class. Some EC. The people who complain are the ones who are either lazy, or are irritated that she was conservative in her lectures. She teaches economics, so it only makes sense... take her!
She talks all lecture and when you try and ask her questions gets so sassy and doesn't answer the question. It was supposed to be an easy A class but she is so difficult and sometimes rude
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lectures were boring, and with some false facts. Most of the first half was common sense info very over explained. Take if you want an easy A, but at the expense of any amount of entertainment or enthusiasm from the professor

Grades fairly easy but all she does is talk in class. Can make an A easily as long as you pay attention. Attendance isn't mandatory but a lot of stuff she teaches in class doesn't get posted online so I would advise to show up and try not to fall asleep. She does give extra credit so take advantage of it.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Kirby is a wonderful professor. She makes econ easy to understand and is more than willing to help you out with anything you may need. Attendance is not mandatory, although her lectures are worth going to. Projects due each Friday, but are very easy and even enjoyable. Would take her every semester if I could. Easy B!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Could not believe how rude and arrogant Mrs. Kirby was. A student asked a question and was completely torn apart and embarrassed by mrs. Kirby in front of the whole class. She rambles about useless things that you won't be tested on. Absolutely terrible experience. Find someone else.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She was a nice lady although, she did seem to come off as arrogant sometimes. There's four test and she drops your lowest one. She wants you to buy to books but you do not need them. All the notes and materials for test are on d2l. She does give practice test and uses most if the same questions on the real rest but changes then up some. HW optional

Can't stand this woman. No point in going to class so don't bother. 3 tests 2 of which are online, drops the lowest grade and a mandatory final. Extra credit assignments but only takes up to 6 extra points even if you get more. Practice test questions online show up on her tests. I had an A til the final and then I failed so bad I ended up with a C
Her lectures are quite long and her tests are quiite picky with information.  Drops a test but you will need to as the material is difficult.  An A is difficult to get.  Too much memorization.

She is a good teacher, but tends to use confusing language and does a fairly poor job of answering questions in class. The class consists of very long lectures, sometimes going past the ending time. However, she provides ample extra credit and drops your lowest exam grade.

If you've ever wanted to experience a boring lecture in all its glory, take Kirby! In all fairness, her class is really easy. Read the book some and attend lectures (though not mandatory). She posts study guides for tests on D2L and even has some extra credit opportunities. Some tests are on D2L. Not very tech-savvy and treats us like children.

She's not terrible, but she isn't great either. She definitely has a conservative view, which is a breath of fresh air.  Tests are easy. Reading isn't really required. She's just boring and not helpful when you ask her a question.  Overall, if you listen to some of her lectures and skim over the book, you'll pass

Tiring, droning, unengaging prof. She fits in small, inaccurate history lessons as she teaches,  & quietly pushes a conservative agenda. If you can stay awake long enough to listen to her, fact check her. When she's not making massive  generalizations, a lot of the non-econ things she says aren't true. Her tests are easy & straight forward.

Two online tests, two in class and she drops the lowest of the 1st three. Very boring and is not helpful. She rants about how "fast food workers" don't deserve more money and has a very conservative stance. Easy A

4 test, two online and two in person. She put "practice questions"s on D2l before every test that are actually the same as the real test. Attendance is a joke, but her lectures are pretty awesome if you actually care. She drops the lowest test grade and there is extra credit for each unit. Highly recommend for an easy a.

Are people really grading her poorly because of her political views haha? If you're get offended over little things then sure, don't take her. If you want THE EASIEST A IN YOUR LIFE ... Take her. Even if it's an 8 am. I made 100's on every test without even studying. She drops your lowest test grade. If you don't get an A you shouldn't be here.
Easy class! Attendance is not mandatory or really necessary. The only thing you get graded on are three OUT of four tests, which three were online! I would take her again. Don't buy the book!!!

Her lectures sucked and it wasn't worth going to class. BUT, all the information you needed was posted to D2L, she also posted a study guide & disclosed that "If it wasn't on the study guide, it wasn't on the test." Only the first and last test are in class. Unless you do the HW for xtra credit, the tests are your only grades. You take initiative.
don't skip her 4 bonus homework points, that will help you at final.

Professor Kirby is great - super easy going and overall a sweet woman.  She only has 4 tests (including the final), but drops to lowest mid-term test.  She can get pretty boring if you have her at 8 or 9 AM, but she's a breeze and definitely one of the easiest classes I've taken at KSU.
Very conservative viewpoints. Very repetitive. Very disorganized.

I would absolutely NOT recommend if you are a decent human being. She is awful and does not appreciate diversity in these United States. Beware if you are a second generation American as she has very clear ideas as who does and does not belong here...

Prof. Kirby was amazing. She is a super understanding teacher and truly wants her students to do well and will do just about anything to make that happen. Cares about her students and it shows. Homework is optional. Other than the first test and the last test, her other 2 tests are online. She makes study guides for her tests as well. GREAT TEACHER

This was my first time taking  an economics course and I have been pleasantly surprised this semester. Professor Kirby is clear and willing to help.  I can tell she enjoys teaching and wants her students to succeed.  If I had to take another economics course, I would enjoy having her as my professor.

Kind of repetitive, tests are easy as long as you use the provided study guide and go to class. Haven't cracked open any of the textbooks, just a waste of money - don't buy them. "Power off your electronic devices" before every class, but she's not strict on it. 8/10 Would take again.
Lectures are dumb. Spends 20 minutes listing examples of really obvious stuff. Gives extra credit. Repetitive.

Love her! She's fantastic at explaining things, but be sure to take good notes! Don't skip too many classes, but one or two is fine. The textbooks aren't necessary, but having them by my side certainly put me at ease (*wink).

Very passionate about what she teaches which is clearly seen in her lectures she uses many anecdotes to drive home concepts. Very happy that I took her Economics class and I would take other classes with her.

She made Econ SO SO SO easy. TAKE HER TAKE HER! Her tests are exactly like the study guides and two of them are online tests. I barely went to class and made an easy A. I would advise you to get the book though, it makes doing the study guides easy.

If you are someone who is empathetic and kind, you should avoid her class at all costs. She will anger you with her rhetoric against people she deems unfit to be living in the United States. It is disgraceful that someone with such backward ideas is being allowed to teach at a state university.

Look... she is NO DOUBT the most boring teacher ever!!! i went to 4 classes and always left because she was so boring. Rambles on about everything and never gets to the point about test material. 2 online test 2 in class. Although she is boring the class is super easy. DONT BUY THE BOOK.

Have gone to class maybe one time and I have an A. Super easy tests, 2 are online and she drops the lowest one. and then everyone has to take the final. Offers a lot of extra credit as well and is nice. Don't buy the books. Easy A

I missed more classes than I went to. She wants you to buy two books, but you don't have to have either. When I was in class, she droned. Even if you liked economics, I could not imagine anyone thoroughly enjoying her. She does not try to trick you with the tests. All are multiple choice and take no more than 30 minutes if you triple-check. Easy.

She's a great teacher. Gives great examples and the practice questions are really helpful for the tests. There's optional homework and only 4 tests, two of which are online. Doesn't really encourage people asking questions and just shoos you away when you do. Just go by good lecture notes and what's posted on d2l and you'll get an A.
Class was interesting. If you take good notes you will do really well.

kirby gives assignments for extra credit but there is no homework. Do not buy the book or commanding heights book just come to class and listen and try to take notes. She doesn't use power points she just writes on the board, shes boring and her lectures are all over the place.  Two test are online 2 are in class. If don't fall asleep you're fine.

Lectures are extremely boring and not helpful.(Which is why I don't go) Practice tests are not helpful. Tests don't always have all the material covered in lecture. They are online and it is easier to take them with a group. Optional hwk assignments are only worth one extra point.

This professor made an easy class extremely hard. Study guides and practice quizzes are provided but not helpful for the tests/quizzes . On top of that thus class very was boring. Save your GPA. Take another professor, it's for your own good.

The class itself isn't hard, but she makes it hard. Ask any question and she will act like you're stupid and contradict herself in the process. Her exams are ridiculous because half the stuff on it has really tricky wording or has nothing to do with what we learned in class or in the book. Do yourself a favor, take this class with someone else.

nice lady, hard professor. Her exams are challenging. Because people were making fun of her easy exams, she made her exam more challenging. The average class grade was a 58%. if you take her, study, study and study. Take a lot of notes.

Professor Kirby is wonderful! She is pleasent to listen to, her examples actually help to clarify what she is talking about, and her notes are excellent. If you go to class, pay attention (which is easy),  and do the study guides then you will do great. The only way to not do well in this class is if you simply don't try. I definitely recommend her

Overall, professor Kirby is not bad. She is VERY repetitive and gives about 100 unnecessary examples. However, her tests are quite easy, 2/4 of them online (and study guides are given). She also gives extra credit opportunities. She's not TERRIBLY boring, but not too interesting either. Relatively easy grade.

AVOID!! SHE IS RUDE AND DOES NOT LIKE BEING ASKED QUESTIONS. SHE TAKES CENTURIES TO RESPOND TO EMAILS. DO NOT TAKE UNLESS YOU WANT TO TEACH YOURSELF. SHE IS REPETITIVE AND LECTURES ARE IRRELEVANT TO THE BOOK. THE PRACTICE QUIZZES FOR EXAMS ARE 400 QUESTIONS LONG SO IT'S IMPOSSIBLE TO KNOW WHAT WILL BE ON THE TESTS.

She is so boring! She repeats herself non-stop! She likes the subject but I had a hard time staying awake in her class. Her tests are awful. Repeated questions, study guides don't help you on the test much and honestly i could not figure out how to study for her class. She doesn't go by the book, she doesn't go by the study guide. She is just awful

Her instructions were vague and useless, there's a group project, and she cannot use time wisely. Google is a better and more engaging teacher. Reading in the class is a must, but if you read the book you will know more about the topic than her.

Take the class with anther professor. Do not ask questions or she'll basically call you stupid. We had a group project and what she actually wanted in the group project did not match up with the rubric she gave us.

This is a no brainer choice for econ 1100. Kirby is brilliant, yet fair. Class attendance is not really mandatory, but it saves having to study too much before the tests. Grade solely depends upon your best 3 of 4 exams. 2 of which are online. Take this class!

Kirby does a great job and gives great examples to help understanding of Economics easy. There are four tests. Three midterms (unit tests) and a final. All three test except for the first test are online. She takes your lowest midterm and replaces it with your final test grade. Her test have no trick questions and easy. It helps going to class.

Pretty easy. First test is in the classroom and al the other tests are online. The final is in the classroom as well. She drops the lowest test grade. Just complete the study guides and go over them before the tests and you'll be fine. I would take her if you have the chance.
Show up to class and this will be the easiest college class you will take! Tests straight from study guide. Don't even really have to take notes just pay attention! All tests very easy!

Boring class and she does tend to get off topic and spend a good chunk of the class off topic. She isn't great about answering emails so I'd go to her office. She is an easy teacher and she is a nice person but she is also kind of in your face with her political views.

Pretty easy class. 4 tests and she drops the lowest(except for final), 2 are on online.  The books are not worth buying. Attending her lectures are about as boring as it gets.  Overall though an easy A if you put a little effort

TAKE HER! easy a. don't buy the textbook; it's useless. it's a boring class (it's econ, dude), but it's super easy to ace. attendance isn't mandatory. i missed quite a few; still got an a. drops your lowest test (x the final) and gives you study guides with the answers basically already on it. use that, take the tests, get an a. DO THE EXTRA CREDIT

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS! She is mean when you ask questions, gives out inaccurate information about her tests, poorly organized, repeats herself ALL THE TIME, and has horrible time management. She is unresponsive to emails. And there are 4 different schedules for the same class, none of which she follows and all of which have different reading info.

TAKE HER. Gives you awesome study guides, and you won't even have to open the book if you attend class. She is easily one of the nicest professors I've ever met, and she obviously wants us all to do well. All we have is 4 tests. In case you missed it the first time, TAKE HER.

She is very easy. Class can be hard to sit through sometimes, but she is very clear in what she is teaching and material is not hard at all. don't buy either book as long as you take good notes.. didn't open either one of them and made a high A

Took 4 tests. Dropped one. First one in class, second two online and final in class. Class is pretty boring but she is very easy to understand and there are no trick questions on exams. Gives plenty of opportunity for extra credit. Easy A.
She is extremely easy. She uses study guides and her tests are simple. My only complaint is she tends to insert her political opinions into the lectures, which is inappropriate.

I would recommend taking her if you don't care about econ and just need to get some gen ed credits taken care of due the easiness and light work load. I had a 3-hour lecture on fridays that were just TERRIBLE to sit through, so I attended class only for 1st and final exam (other 2 exams were online) for a total of about 7 times and earned an A.
LOVE HER TAKE HER SOOO EASY AND COOL! SHE GIVES STUDY GUIDES AND MAKES EVERYTHING SO CLEAR!! AND SHE BRINGS SNACKS TO CLASS LOVE HER!!

She's very clear an explains things with many examples and in different ways. It can get repetitive, but it made it much easier to understand. If you show up to class, do the study guides, and look over the notes and powerpoints, you can easily make an A. Study guides are also posted way ahead of time, giving you plenty of time to do it.
Her lectures are extremely boring and she can be very repetitive. But overall it is a good class.

Tends to simply lecture. Don't ask a question,unless you're ready for an unclear answer or a repetition of what she's already said. Naturally, if you study the material getting and A is easy. I read the textbooks only and got an A on my quizzes so missing class isn't that much of a big deal except for announcements(which are still posted on D2L)
She is extremely well versed. I am not remotely interested in econ but with a little studying and reading you should get an A with little effort. She puts up many notes and study guides

Loved her class! I didn't really like econ going into it but she made the test easy enough to where you could understand it. Study the practice tests, some of the same questions will be asked on the test. Take her for an easy A.
Do NOT ask questions in her class, or you'll regret it!

I just finished this class today and made an A. I didn't buy the book but I'm sure it would help you a little more on the tests. We took three tests, two of them were online, and then the final. She takes The two highest grades of the three tests, and then your final test grade to get your final class grade. Class was boring at times.

Kirby is a wonderful professor. She definitely helps you understand econ better. All of her test are easy. Total of 4 grades which are all test and she drops the lowest one. 2 are online. Class is not mandatory. Most notes online. She also brings food to class to share!

I enjoyed her 8 am class and found it lively.  I’ve never taken ECON so I was nervous.  There were 4 exams and she gives you a helpful, detailed study guide for each test.  She drops what she does not cover.  I found her focused and does not encourage questions in the 50minute class.  I would recommend her and yes I see the world differently. TAKE.

Fairly easy class. Total of 4 exams. First exam in class...rest are online. Lectures are tad bit boring. Study guides are available as well as practice tests online. Textbook not required but Commanding Heights book helped a lot. Attendance not mandatory but she will randomly pass a sign in around for 1 point. No homework or papers.
One of the easiest classes I've ever taken. I went to class MAYBE 8 or 9 times and got an A.

Sincerely concerned with the students' well-being. She is very helpful to those seeking help, and truly goes above and beyond to try to be clear and helpful. That being said, she has a tendency to over explain simple concepts, and the class was(to me) sickeningly easy. If you're seeking a challenge, you may be disappointed, but great for an easy A.

She gets boring at times, but overall it's a good class.  3 tests, she provides study guides, and there were NO TRICK QUESTIONS.  Go to class, though!  Even if you fall asleep, she passes a sign up sheet on random days and adds a whole point to your final grade if you're there all the time.

There were 3 tests.  No Homework.YOU DO NOT NEED THE BOOKS.  She supplies power points, supplemental handouts for text,& the all study guides on Vista.She does not take attendance, randomly took it 5 times & gave us extra points at the end of the semester.tests are NON CUMULATIVE! Sign up for her-you'll be glad you did

Took summer class. Only 3 tests and that's IT: 1st was in-class, 2nd was online, 3rd was the final and it was in-class. Attendance not mandatory...if she notices a lot of people missing she'll pass out a paper for the people who are there and reward them. Never starts late, never ends early. Read from books often - she tends to complicate things.

1 group country paper worth 20% so find a good group, Class Participation(mainly attendance and discussion board posts)worth 25%, Test 1 and 2 worth 20% each. Test three is optional if you are ok with your group paper grade(she will make it count for this test) She allows cheat sheet for tests. Make sure you go to class bc she takes attendance.

She is honestly, the BEST teacher I have ever had. I had her for ECON 1100! I did not like economics until I had her as a teacher! Her tests are easy they are straight from her notes, and she is always willing to help you. She makes jokes in class, and makes economics as interesting as possible! If you can get any ECON teacher TAKE KIRBY!!!
She explained things very well. She was very helpful if you needed her.

She will most likely change her attendance policy after poor attendance with our class, but this is by far the easiest class I've taken at KSU thus far. I got an A and rarely attended. Exams were online and straight from the study guide, answers in the book. I would definitely recommend her if you want an easy A.
Not clear with directions what so ever. changes rule often without notice. not understanding of individual situations. monotone and constant incomplete sentences when lecturing

if you're taking econ 1101, TAKE KIRBY!! There are 4 tests(1 regular, 2 online, and the final) lowest is dropped. Attendance isnt mandatory and she posts study guides. You can get away with not getting the book too. This is definitely the EASIEST A you will ever get at KSU!! Ive had high school classes that were harder than this

if you're taking econ 1101, TAKE KIRBY! There are 4 tests(1 regular, 2 online, and the final). Lowest is dropped. Attendance not mandatory and she posts study guides. You can get away with not getting the book too. This is the definitely the EASIEST A you will get at KSU!!! Ive had high school classes that were harder than this
Easiest class ever. Take notes study a little bit and you will get an A.

I don't know why anyone would have a difficult time in 1101. I made 100 on the first test, a 98 on the second and then didn't go to class again for two and a half months. Looked at the study guide the night before the final, made a 90 on the exam, 96 in the class. EASY A.

"Global Econ." is a lie. Only Europe and the USA are discussed though the syllabus and textbook detail much more. Weeks spent lecturing on post-WWII Britain and multiple days on the Reagan era. She's very nice, but she hasn't moved into the 21st century in teaching and she teaches the same material for days on end. A VERY easy A.
So grateful attendance wasn't mandatory. She's nice, but dull - makes no effort at all to interest students in the material. First test is a breeze, but they get harder after that.

She is a nice lady and is extremely smart. She actually knows what she is talking about but her lectures are extremely boring. She starts on time and ends on time...nothing in between. She doesn't really care for class participation in fact she really does all of the talking...all the time. Nice lady-kill joy though.

This class was brutal because Kirby made it brutal. Her lectures are EXTREMELY BORING, which is sad because Economic Development is such an interesting subject. The team country paper was easy but tedious. Cover all the parts she wants and you'll get an A on it. Tests are all insanely easy. Easy A class but very frustrating to deal with.

sweetest lady ever but this class is extremely boring.i feel awful for saying this but this class is not worth going to!there were 2 online tests and 2 in class.only went to class on test days and managed to get a b in the class. take it if you just need to get it out of the way and you wont learn anything from this class.

Dr. Kirby is a great teacher. Attendance is not required but I recommend it. This class is an easy A if you attend and take good notes. Most of her test question come straight from her lectures. I used the book to look up some vocabulary but that was about it. I liked how she always reviewed the previous days lecture. SHE GRADES FAIRLY.

I would not recommend Kirby at all. Nothing you talk about in class is relevant to the assignments due. She rambles on and does not encourage class participation. If you ask a question, she will act like you are an idiot for asking when really I'm just not sure if she knows the answer. not super hard but not easy enough to take

Great Teacher.. Helps you understand and always touches on previous days lecture to make sure you follow what she is teaching..I would take her again anytime for any Econ Class.. She's Great Take her..
Nice lady, but lectures were boring. Heavy user of WebCT Vista, but her page is very disorganized.

She is a very nice lady, genuinely cares about students. While her class was fairly easy it was a nightmare trying to navigate her labyrinth of folders on vista to find the information I actually needed, she may benefit from some organizational skills. Other than that she is very knowledgeable, a little hard to follow, but easy A.

As others have said, don't take her beyond econ 1000 unless you want an absolutely worthless elective A. Very very easy course with a professor who not only expects little to nothing out of students, but also doesn't allow them to discuss the material or disagree with her. Regurgitation course when the material is clearly subjective
SOOO Boring. But no attendance and if you just study a little for each test its a pretty easy class. Your grade is an average of your test scores. There are 4 total and the lowest is dropped.
She's pretty easy if you prepare for the tests using the study guides she posts on vista. She will bore you to death in class though.

Show up for class. Take good notes. Prepare for tests with study guides she posts on vista and you're golden. She is a total supply-side policy wonk, but she really seems to care about her students and you can tell she enjoys teaching the class. I would take her again for sure!

Prof Kirby is the Best. She Knows the materials that she teaches inside out. She made me get real interest in Economics. She is very clear and in-depth on her lectures. If you have an interest in Economics She is a must take Professor. Just come to class take notes and read her power points & study guides and you will do just fine.

Do not take her for any other Economics class above 1100. Her lectures are monotonous and repeating: we spent 3 lectures talking about a simple economic growth model that all the students likely understood already. Her exams require you to write essays that have to be completely in-depth (read: explaining things to toddlers) for full credit.

OMG... this class is amazing, but I must warn you there is a lot of work involved. I've never had a professor that cared so much about the students, and she will go out of her way to help you. the book is a must have. JK I <3 sarcasm!!!!

Ive had dozens of professors so far and this is the first one that is truly awful. She doesn't allow anyone to ask questions or comment on her narrow-minded opinions! If you do get your point of view expressed, it'll be shot down instantly regardless. Easy A with exam crib sheets and study guides, but you'll be totally miserable along the way.

She's a nice lady and has a real interest in econ. I hate econ because its just boring to me, but she kinda made it interesting. She doesn't care about attendance and puts notes online. Her tests come straight from study guides and you get to drop the lowest test grade. One test was online. It was a pretty easy class. I would take her.

Definitely an easy course. Attendance not required. Lowest of 3 test scores dropped, final exam mandatory. Study guides for each test with answers easily found in material she has online. Attending lectures made it even easier. Her lectures can drag on a bit, but they aren't horrible. Overall, a good class.

She is the best.ppl talk bad about her cause she really cares that u learn something extremely sweet,very easy exams and u can drop the lowest. genuinely kind, she let me use her book to study she doesn't take attendance if you don't want to attend then don't ask her questions. but very helpful and understanding to sum up this class is an EASY A+

The class was easy for me so I actually stopped going and boy, did that make her mad. She is not happy knowing a student can do well without hearing her lectures. All the notes are online and she posts a study guide for every test. If you do the study guide you will do fine, class is pointless but the books are necessary.

I am a good student, work hard, have excellent grades, don't have problems with professors or the school. Some Professors I have not liked because of different points of view or teaching styles that do not match my learning style.    I had never used this website; however, this time I feel that is my duty to  tell you STAY AWAY FROM PROF. KIRBY!

Really boring class,but prof. Kirby is genuinely kind and helpful. I didn't buy any of the books and studied minimally for every test and still made an A. She is really sweet, and although she is a bit scattered she really knows her stuff.

Econ 1101 is not a fun class, but it's a requirement, so you might as well take Kirby 'cause she's easy. You don't need a textbook and there's no attendance policy, which is pretty awesome. The final is mandatory, but she'll drop the lowest grade of the prior 3 tests.

I know more about Economics now than I did before.  Professor Kirby is very knowledgable about the subject.  She makes sure that students get the concepts of economics.  I can now apply  the tools she implemented during the course.  I love her attire.  Business!

I dont know where all of these negative comments are coming from. If you have to take Econ 1100 TAKE KIRBY!! She is not that interesting but I can bet you will get an A or a B! She is an extremely nice lady!! TAKE HER!

She was a nice lady, but repeated lectures CONSTANTLY! About 1/4 of the class came to lectures. One test is online.  Offered extra credit at the end of the semester. Wasn't my favorite teacher, and I wouldn't recommend her. I felt like I didn't get anything out of her class, even though I got an A.

This teacher is really passionate about Econ, but its kind of sad because only like a fourth of the students ever show up for lecture. Her tests are really easy and she is really nice and she will help you if you approach her with a question.  Overall it's an easy A, however the lectures are really dull and the Vista page is a mess!

She's very disorganized. She's never on time. She rambles on about the dumbest things. She will lecture about the same things from the previous day. I got a B+ but it was no thanks to her. She says one thing and does another. I wouldn't recommend her.

Loves the subject, but no one else seems to. No more than 1/4 of the class was ever there except on test days. EASY tests with front/back cheat sheet and prepared 1-page essay. She gives all of the project info on Vista, you just have to do it. If 90% of the class does the teacher evaluation everyone gets 3 pts!
Lectures can be boring at times, and the work load a little much but doable. All in all easy class, nice lady.

Good lectures, throws in life examples and explains any math. Easy tests. She repeats material a bit, but its nice if you need to miss a day of class. Overall a excellent teacher and would take her again.

Does'nt answer emails. Class is boring. Unorganized class, website, assignments. Does not have a set schedule, impossible to know what is due more than a week or so in advance. Lots of group project stuff, with little warning of assignment and due date.

She is an okay teacher.  Reads directly from powerpoints.  Has you read thousands of pages of different articles on webct.  I feel as though she thinks this is the only class that I am taking and have time to read allllll that stuff.  TONS of reading but other than that fairly decent teacher.

Had her for econ. She does tend to ramble on about stuff that has nothing to do with the class. She was really nice and man I thought she was hot for an older lady. i hardly went to class and got a B.

I didn't go to class for a month and a half (between 2nd and 3rd test), and still made an A in the class. She rambles on and on about the littlest details, things that don't matter, but if you are somewhat intelligent you should do well in the class. DO NOT buy the book - I had to return mine a few weeks into the class. Easiest class I've ever!
Sweetest most understanding lady.  I turned in my final paper three days late with no excuse and she says, "oh that's fine honey, i won't take any points off."

If you read the material and actually refrence all of the documants and videos she posts the class will be an easy A, I slacked off and didn't even know what she was talking about all semester and still ended u with a B. Not that hard just really boring and repetitive, but it may have been the subject matter.

Wonderful! Explains everything in great detail! The test is not a suprise!  I would and have recommended her.  Economics is boring in general, but she teaches it very well, and knows how to explain the material to a tee

She will give lecture the entire time and doesnt like a lot of questions.  If you can answer the study guide questions, you can ace the test.  She drones on about useless things much of the time, but is pleasant enough. Just know your study guide and you will be ok.
This class is soooo boring. Do not buy textbooks, and yes you can skip class. Teacher ignores ALL questions, which defeats the point of being in college and not high school. Drop her class!

This teacher is awesome! If you don't get an A, you're a moron because she spoon feeds you everything. If you are one of those students that likes to blab in class just to hear your own voice, she will shoot you down, which is hilarious to the rest of us that get annoyed by you people. DON'T buy the book, you don't need it if you come to class.

Not my favorite teacher. The 2nd day of class after 3 different students had raised their hand and were ignored, someone yelled out thier question, and she finally answered it.  After that, the class just started asking questions w/o raising their hand.  She is knowledgeable, but boring and gives 20 examples for the most basic concepts. Easy tests!

attendance is taken every class. 50-100 diff links on her cluttered webct. rambles forever. occasionally talks longer than class period. class should be a social science class rather than an econ class. easy A or B without paying attention. bring something else to do otherwise youll fall asleep.

Very easy class!! 80% of test questions come from WebCT 20% of test questions come from common knowledge or lecture. No attendance taking. Don't buy the books. 4 tests, lowest non-final test score is dropped. Very thorough teacher, but rambles a little bit. Overall, a little boring but very interesting at points. Take this instructor!! :-)

Attendance not manadatory.A is possible w/ minimal attendance. Every Monday 1/2 pg hw over assigned country. Her practice tests are the exam quesitons. WEBCT is scattered and disorganized. Dont buy the book. Lowest test dropped except for the last one (not comprehensive final just a regular test but it cant be dropped) Easy A.

Great Professor! There are times in lecture that if you just placed a frame around her face and a skyline in the background she could be a news analyst. Very informative! Doesn't penalize for missing class (which is GREAT during summer semester!) and drops your lowest test grade. Nice lady.

Class is super boring and rambles forever. 10 homework assignments due every week. Don't use the book when studying for the test..its pointless, use her powerpoints instead. Tests are MC, drops your lowest. It's an easy A or a B. Take her!

Probably the most boring class I have ever taken in my life.. She rambles about things that are unrelated to the topic or just takes every example farther than it needs to go. If you can stay awake (which you probably can't) you will have an EASY A though.

EASIEST CLASS EVER yes boring but EASY! Weekly "current event" hw assignments that you right a paragraph about. Tests are DIRECTLY from lecture notes. GO TO CLASS. She gives study guides, USE THEM! Shes very boring and DROPS LOWEST TEST GRADE! Lazy/Ignorant ppl failed this class, and its sad.

This teacher is horrible!! She repeats herself over and over and rambles about pointless things. She is incredibly boring and will start a new topic five minutes before class is supposed to end. Our first test she didn't print enough copies of the test and 1/4 of the class had to wait for a good 30 minutes for her to make copies! Stay away!!!
Could hardly stay awake in this class last semester. Very boring. I'm so glad that class is over!!
So. Boring. Difficult to pay attention in class, but if you study your notes, the WEBCT notes and do the homework it's easy to make an A.

Professor Kirby's class is extremely easy! She is the sweetest lady ever but has no sense of time! If you like getting out of class early, you wont! Other than that...she posts everything on vista and tests are straight from the study guides! take her!
Pretty easy class.  She never takes attendance and puts everything on WebCT.  If you just go by her study guides and study all her postings well, you should get good grades.  I would recommend.

TAKE HER IF YOU WANT EASY A OR B! Listen the CLASS IS BORING BUT EASY. JUST GO TO CLASS and TAKE NOTES, plus read ALL notes on WEBCT and COMPLETE the STUDY GUIDES! U WILL GET AN A! Her HOMEWORK s so EASY and she always gives 100 on them if you just DO IT! SO SO EASY just GO TO CLASS TAKE NOTES AND DO STUDY GUIDE! EASY but VERY BORING. JUST TAKE HER

So painfully boring, but super easy. Everything she reviews before the tests will be on the tests, so show up for the reviews. I wouldn't waste my money on the text book--just use the materials she puts on WebCT.

I hated economics with a passion before this class and although I still don't like it I survived it and learned a couple things in Kirby's class. Her lectures are boring but what she writes on the board is what is on the test. Study guides are helpful and she always does at least a 30 minute review before each test (on test day) that helps alot.
BORINGGGGG.... tests are nothing from the notes or book.
Good teacher. She's really nice and tries to help you as much as possible. Paragraph/ newspaper article due each week and about 4 tests. Pay attention and take notes and you should do well.

THE BEST PROFESSOR EVER. THIS LADY KNOWS HER STUFF, HELPS YOU UNDERSTAND THE THEORY AND THE APPLICATION IN REAL WORLD. I'VE LEARNED WITH HER MORE STUFF THAN WHAT I HAVE LEARNED IN YEARS... BEST AT KSU. PEOPLE THAT DON'T IGNORANT OF REAL WORL ECON MIGHT FEEL BORED...

Dr. Kirby is so sweet!  Her class is really easy, she gives reviews right before the tests, and she dresses really cute all the time (always in business attire).  She is also very knowledgable in economics and has lots of stories from her experiences.

Very boring, but its college so get over it. She spends about the first half of each class going over the last half of the previous class. can go over her alloted time by a good 20-30 min. I would not recommend this teacher

She's a very nice lady but this class was SO BORING!!! I wouldn't recommend her at all. She's the type of teacher that is bad but you feel sorry for her cause she's so sweet. She repeats everything 50 million times and she give a billion unnecessary examples for everything. I would take someone else if you can. 4 Test and current events every week.
So repetitive. I can't even stand to go most times. She seems nice though. Just use the study guides for tests and you'll be fine.

This economics overview class was incredibly boring to the point that I had to walk out almost half the time. When I did stay I would fall asleep, and on one occasion started snoring so loudly that another kid woke me up. I made a 'B' though so take it for what it's worth.

You don’t really learn anything in her class because tests and quizzes are open note. I got an A, and I would not show up to class 2 weeks straight. You have to be pretty stupid to get anything less than a B.

She is BORING! The book is useless, but her stuff on WebCTVista is great. She repeats stuff endlessly! Tests are not hard because she gives a study guide which completly covers it. She doesn't really read your papers or answer questions. She is otherwise nice and easy grader, but she takes forever to post grades.

She is by far the most biased teacher I have ever met, but itis easy to get an A in her class.  Don't waste time reading the book, take detailed notes and you will do well on the tests. She cannot portray history or political issues in an accurate manner, she won't answer your questions if it doesn't go along with what she wants students to think.
Reading the books and actually going to class will get you an A. Kirby is very nice and she reviews right before every test which is very helpful.

Kirby is crazy. Bottom line. Repeats herself constantly. Homework is easy. Tests can be a little hard, so study. Lectures are boring because you find yourself taking notes on the same material you did the past two classes. Overall, pay attention, take notes, do your homework- and you'll be fine.

Kirby's class is pretty easy.  She repeats herself a lot so you have plenty of chances to learn the material.  It's possible to get really bored during her lectures because of that.  The homework is easy and she provides notes on WebCT.  If you just go to class and listen you'll have no problems whatsoever.

Easy class! She is very nice but very boring. There is no attendance policy and she post notes and key terms to study on web ct. She also gives a review before each test which helps a lot.  The homework is easy and you get credit just for doing it.

This class was a breeze!  The "homework"- while it was due once a week- was very easy.  The tests are straight forward- multiple choice, T/F.  If you have questions, ask her either before/after class and you will get a much better response from her!  Take her and enjoy the A!
Dont take class with this lady. She gives endless HW. She is very repetitive and she makes the class boring....................... Take it with another professor.
Very repetitive but puts all class notes on Web CT. Class is boring and there is homework every week but it's given way ahead of time.
this class is super boring, but easy. you have homework due every week, but you can work in huge groups, so you end up doing 1 or 2 throught the semester. take this class.

Requires article summaries EVERY week, you get credit just for doing them.  This class will not clarify anything, but you have take home midterms and open note finals.  No attendance policy but test questions come from lectures and the lectures are boring!  Easy B without effort, you will get an A if you put a little bit of time in it.

Excellent teacher and easy to understand. Sometimes even gives take-home tests. Requires that you write a summary of a news article once a week but only grades you on whether or not you did it. No attendance policy.

horrible teacher!!! yea you can use notes on quizes/tests, but the only test in there is a final and it takes her a month to hand back quizes...very hard to understand what she goes over in class and wont slow down to help you understand at all.

Very repetitive goes over the same lecture three days in a row sometimes.  All test and quiz material from notes. Buying the book was a waste of money.  Also will have many homework assignments that seem to be busy work.

This lady is very hard to follow but she's a very easy teacher.  She lets you use your notes on all tests and quizzes.  You are responsible for homework and writing a short one page group article paper a week, but she gives you a grade based on whether it is completed or not.
